sections.text: **Purpose.** Summarize Part 1 telemetry (participation + friction signals) and identify decision-critical patterns to shape Part 2 (targeted definition locks + red-zone rewrites).

heading_path: Values & Principles Survey — Part 1 (Complete) — Telemetry & Triage Snapshot
F3 approvals: convergence vs blockers
Overall
sections.text:
- **Total F3 items:** 23
- **Overall approval rate (all items × all respondents):** 69.6%
- **Zones:** {'Green': 9, 'Yellow': 8, 'Red': 6}  
  - **Green (≥80% approve):** safe to merge w/ light edits  
  - **Yellow (60–79% approve):** converging; needs tightening/definitions  
  - **Red (<60% approve):** must be rewritten into decision-ready alternatives for Meeting 4

heading_path: Values & Principles Survey — Part 1 (Complete) — Telemetry & Triage Snapshot
Tradeoffs (T1–T7): where the committee is split
sections.text:
| Tradeoff   |   A |   B |   C |   Need more info | Lead           |
|:-----------|----:|----:|----:|-----------------:|:---------------|
| T1         |   0 |   3 |   4 |                3 | C              |
| T2         |   2 |   0 |   8 |                0 | C              |
| T3         |   4 |   1 |   4 |                1 | A              |
| T4         |   1 |   0 |   4 |                5 | Need more info |
| T5         |   1 |   1 |   7 |                1 | C              |
| T6         |   1 |   0 |   7 |                2 | C              |
| T7         |   2 |   0 |   7 |                1 | C              |

**Interpretation cues**
- **T4 (Notice/consent/opt-out)** is the biggest ambiguity signal (highest “Need more info”). This is a *definitions/scoping* problem more than a values problem.
- **T1 (Assessment validity posture)** shows mixed preference between “design/process evidence” vs “hybrid w/ restrictions when needed,” again driven by definition ambiguity (“high-stakes,” “process evidence,” feasibility).
- **T2, T5, T6, T7** show strong directional convergence toward “Option C” style guardrailed middle paths.

heading_path: Values & Principles Survey — Part 1 (Complete) — Telemetry & Triage Snapshot
TR lenses (what people are optimizing for)
sections.text:
Top lenses selected across **F3 + tradeoffs**:

| TR   | Lens                                           |   Selections | Share   |
|:-----|:-----------------------------------------------|-------------:|:--------|
| TR7  | Feasibility, workload & sustainability         |          114 | 19%     |
| TR1  | Learning impact & deep skills                  |          108 | 18%     |
| TR6  | Transparency, accountability & community trust |           86 | 15%     |
| TR2  | Assessment validity & academic integrity       |           82 | 14%     |
| TR3  | Equity, accessibility & inclusion              |           65 | 11%     |
| TR5  | Student safety & developmental appropriateness |           56 | 10%     |
| TR8  | Evidence, monitoring & reversibility           |           43 | 7%      |
| TR4  | Privacy, security & data minimization          |           33 | 6%      |

**Reading this:** Feasibility/workload (TR7) and learning impact/deep skills (TR1) dominate. Trust/transparency (TR6) and integrity (TR2) are close behind. Part 2 should make the “feasible + protects learning” path explicit.

---
